The chunk should be placed within a section discussing the setup and application of materials or shaders in Maya, specifically when configuring textures and normal maps for models intended for export to Panda3D. This context is essential for users preparing their 3D assets correctly before using the maya2egg exporter.

Context: When setting up textured models in Maya for export to Panda3D, it's crucial to ensure materials and shaders are configured properly.

A straightforwardly textured model will look like this in the hypershade:

To apply a normal map, create another file texture and connect the "out color" of the normal map to the "normal camera" input of the phong shader. The normal map must be a true normal map (you can recognize them by their light blue color), not a bump map (which are black-and-white.)
